column5: Poverty type
column7: Child (0 to 18 years of age) , concentrated or overall

column5: Total number of people or children in the geographic unit. For concentrated poverty it is the total number of poor people.  (Denominator of the percent)

Total number of poor people or total number of poor children in the geographic unit.  For concentrated poverty it is the number of poor people that live in census tracts with overall poverty  ≥ 40% . (Numerator of the percent)
Overall, concentrated, or child poverty rate (numerator/denominator*100)

California decile
column7: CA_decile' groups California places into 10 groups (or deciles) each, for total population. Equal values or 'ties' are assigned the mean decile rank. For example, in a database of 100 records where 70 records equal 0, 0 values span from the 1st to 7th deciles (70% of all data records).

column5: Rate ratio to California rate
Census tracts that were included ("yes") or excluded ("no") from the concentrated poverty calculations based on certain criteria.*
